001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
004
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
011
012
013/**
014 * This class defines methods for estimating the radial lens distortion parameters
015 * 
016 * @author W. Burger
017 *
018 */
019public class RadialDistortionEstimator {
020        
021        /**
022         * Estimates the lens distortion from multiple views, starting from an initial (linear) camera model.
023         * @param cam the initial (linear) camera model
024         * @param views a sequence of extrinsic view transformations
025         * @param modelPts the set of 2D model points (on the planar calibration target)
026         * @param obsPts a sequence of 2D image point sets, one set for each view
027         * @return a vector of lens distortion coefficients
028         */
029        protected double[] estimateLensDistortion(Camera cam, ViewTransform[] views, Point2D[] modelPts, Point2D[][] obsPts) {
030                final int M = views.length;             // the number of views
031                final int N = modelPts.length;  // the number of model points
032
033                final double uc = cam.getUc();
034                final double vc = cam.getVc();
035
036                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2 * M * N, 2);
037                RealVector d = new ArrayRealVector(2 * M * N);
038
039                int l = 0;
040                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
041                        Point2D[] obs = obsPts[i];
042
043                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
044                                // determine the radius in the ideal image plane
045                                double[] xy = cam.projectNormalized(views[i], modelPts[j]);
046                                double x = xy[0];
047                                double y = xy[1];
048                                double r2 = x * x + y * y;
049                                double r4 = r2 * r2;
050                                
051                                // project model point to image
052                                double[] uv = cam.project(views[i], modelPts[j]);
053                                double u = uv[0];
054                                double v = uv[1];
055                                double du = u - uc;     // distance to estim. projection center
056                                double dv = v - vc;
057                                
058                                D.setEntry(l * 2 + 0, 0, du * r2);
059                                D.setEntry(l * 2 + 0, 1, du * r4);
060                                D.setEntry(l * 2 + 1, 0, dv * r2);
061                                D.setEntry(l * 2 + 1, 1, dv * r4);
062                                
063                                // observed image point
064                                Point2D UV = obs[j];
065                                double U = UV.getX();
066                                double V = UV.getY();
067                                
068                                d.setEntry(l * 2 + 0, U - u);
069                                d.setEntry(l * 2 + 1, V - v);
070                                l++;
071                        }
072                }
073                
074                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(D).getSolver();
075                RealVector k = solver.solve(d);
076                
077//              double err1 = D.operate(new ArrayRealVector(new double[] {0,0})).subtract(d).getNorm();
078//              double err2 = D.operate(k).subtract(d).getNorm();
079//              System.out.format("err1=%.2f, err2=%.2f \n", err1, err2);
080                
081                return k.toArray();
082        }
083
084}
